intro: Chondrilla intybacea, commonly known as the desert hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy, succulent stems. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through its deep root system and water-storing tissues. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, aiding in its dispersal. Chondrilla intybacea is often found in rocky soils and is a component of desert and semi-desert ecosystems.
